p: Ascaris lumbricoides affects at least one million people in the developing world. Infection is through ingestion of contaminated fruits and vegetables. There may be respiratory symptoms with cough and wheezing and occasional hepatomegaly. Infection of the biliary tree leads to calculus formation. Obstructive jaundice, cholangitis, and liver abscesses may be seen. Treatment is with mebendazole, albendazole, or pyrantel pamoate. Endoscopic or surgical interventions may be required for intestinal or biliary obstruction [ 56].
